## Overview

This is it — the culmination of your semester's work. Your final web portfolio demonstrates your journey from curiosity to evidence, from vibes to variables. Submit a complete, polished, reproducible research portfolio.

## Final Portfolio Requirements (100 pts)

### Content (60 pts)

Your portfolio must include the following pages:

1. **Home / Introduction (15 pts)**
   - Research question and its significance
   - Theoretical framework
   - Brief literature context

2. **Method (15 pts)**
   - Data source and sampling strategy
   - Codebook summary (or link to full codebook)
   - Data collection process
   - Analytical approach

3. **Results (15 pts)**
   - Descriptive statistics with visualizations
   - Inferential statistics with effect sizes
   - Clear, labeled tables and figures

4. **Discussion (15 pts)**
   - Interpretation of findings
   - Connection to theory and literature
   - Limitations and future directions
   - Conclusion

### Technical Quality (20 pts)

- [ ] Site renders without errors (5 pts)
- [ ] All R code executes correctly (5 pts)
- [ ] Visualizations are professional and labeled (5 pts)
- [ ] Navigation works across all pages (5 pts)

### Presentation (20 pts)

- [ ] Writing is clear and professional (5 pts)
- [ ] APA formatting for citations and references (5 pts)
- [ ] Consistent visual design throughout (5 pts)
- [ ] Portfolio tells a coherent research story (5 pts)

## Submission Instructions

1. Render your complete portfolio site
2. Verify all pages render correctly
3. Upload the rendered site (or GitHub Pages link) to Blackboard
4. Include a brief cover note describing your project in 2–3 sentences

## Grading Rubric Summary

| Component | Points |
|-----------|--------|
| Home / Introduction | 15 |
| Method | 15 |
| Results | 15 |
| Discussion | 15 |
| Technical Quality | 20 |
| Presentation | 20 |
| **Total** | **100** |

## Submission Checklist

- [ ] All four portfolio pages complete
